titleStmt.title: W. Peck et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8002

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
Bath County
Sharpsburg Ky May 9th 63
To his Excellency
Gov. Jas F. Robinson

Dr Sir The undersigned citizens of Sharpsburg District would respectfully make known to your Excellency, that because of the troubles in our county, which have caused our Court Judge to absent himself from home, to avoid personal violence from the rebels, we have had no Court since his election to office. Consequently no officers appointed to conduct the election which should have been held for the election of Justices & Constables on the 1st Saturday Inst -- And as, without an election is held by the first day of June next, we will be without the benefit of a Court at our regular June Term, we would respectfully ask your Excellency to Commission James S. Ramy a Justice of the Peace for this District from the 1st day of June, when his present term expires.

W. Peck
Jno H Campton
Thos G. Whaley
George A Whitney
J W Stephens
E B Sanders
L A Brown
Thomas J. Atkinson
F. E. Cougleton
W, L, Lane
James Smathers
Richard Crouch
Jas W Burns
Q. A. Bogil
J. S. Berry
S Poland
W A Cunningham
Y. M. Grunsant
C P Van Pelk
Archie Brerin
Robt Howe
Joseph Stephens
J. H. Henry
H. I Baird
Thos Sharp
C P Browning
Gov Robinson will please act upon the above petition as soon as possible and oblige his

No election having been held for Justices of the Peace at the time fixed by law -- a vacancy existed in Sharpsburg district Bath Co. Ky. -- (See 1 S. R. S. p. 439.) which vacancy can be temporarily filled, until Aug. Election, by the Governor (ib. p. 441.)

The within presents a proper case for a commission to the person recommended or any other the Govr may think proper to appoint -- to run till the August Election, and until his successor shall be qualified.

Bath Co.
J. P.
Dist No 1.
Appd June 1. 1863.
